title: The One With All The Jealousy

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her first day.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (running in from her bedroom, wearing only a towel) Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's gonna focus on that as long as your wearing that towel dress.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Tell him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert, y'know he's the botanist.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh God. Y'know, botanists are such geeks.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hmm? Oh, yeah. (he makes a growling sound)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering, with about 20 purses hanging around her neck) Morning. Rach, I'm here with the purses!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) It must take you forever to find your keys.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (running into the living room) Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Honey, just relax, it's gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down there and I'll take you out to lunch?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. (to Phoebe) Is this actually a lunchbox?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Hey, so can you make it on Friday?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can see a stripper.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so cliché. Why don't you get a magician?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all right.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Chandler are entering, Joey is on the phone.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She's having lunch with him. She's having lunch with him. And you should of seen the hug she gave him when she got the job. And, and, and, (to Joey) he's really good looking. (Joey gives an enthusiastic thumbs up) What am I gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Don't do anything. Keep it inside. Learn how to hide your feelings! (pause) Don't cry outloud.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (hanging up the phone) Yes! Guess who's in an audition for a Broadway musical?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I want to say you but, that seems like such an easy answer.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It is me! It's a musical version of Tale of Two Cities . So I think I'm gonna sing New York, New York , and ah, oh I left My Heart in San Francisco .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah Joey, I don't think you get to pick the cities.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mr. Dickens gets to pick 'em.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'll get you the Cliff Notes.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The what?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The abridgment.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, okay. (to Ross) The what?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel's office, Mark is training Rachel.]

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: ...and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date. Good. Any questions so far?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah. What kind of discount do we get?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Twenty percent.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!! I love this job! (her phone rings) Wow! My first call.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Here, let me. (answers phone) Rachel Green's line, how may I help you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hi, is Rachel there?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: And who may I say is calling?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: This is Ross?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Ross of.....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Of Ross and Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Oh hi. It's, it's Mark.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh hey, hey Mark.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Hey, hold on a second.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi honey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi! What's ah, what's Mark doing answering your phone?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, he's just goofing around.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ohhhhh yeah, that's, that's funny. Why ah, why isn't he goofing around in his own office?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we're Joanna's two assistants.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I gotta go. (to Mark) Mark, I need you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, bye-bye. (starts slamming the receiver down in anger.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow! Ross!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, I'm, I'm, I'm sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I'm dialing another number. (hangs up)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Moondance diner, Monica is cleaning up with one of the waiters, with her
back turned to him she removes her fake breasts and hides them under her wig.]

dialogue.speaker: JEANNINE
dialogue.text: (to Monica) All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can be alone with him. You'd better go for it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Please, I'm not going for anything.

dialogue.speaker: JEANNINE
dialogue.text: Well, if you don't, I will.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Would you please go?

dialogue.speaker: JEANNINE
dialogue.text: Night Mon. Night Julio.

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: (to Jeannine) Adios.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look Julio, someone left their book here.

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: Ah actually, that is mine.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, what are you reading?

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Have I read it? (pause) No, are you enjoying it?

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: I thought I would, but the translation's no good.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Your a poet and don't know it. (she turns away and makes a face like 'I can't believe I just said that.')

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: Actually I ah, I am a poet.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, then you do know it. (pause) So um what kind of things do you write about?

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip. (points to her lip)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Mine? (points to her lower lip) Right here?

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: I can write an epic poem about this lip. (grabs her lower lip)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How would that go? (they kiss) Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (singing) You've got to pick a pocket or two. Boyyyyssss, (picks a handkerchief from the pianist's pocket) you've got to pick a pocket or two..........

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Lovely, just lovely.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Really? Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the callback on Saturday.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Excellent, I'll be there.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Okay, and listen don't forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance audition.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ahhh! My ah, my agent said it wasn't a dancing part.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Joey, all the roles got to dance a little. But believe me with your dance background it'll be a piece of cake.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is reading Joey's resume.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ....three years of modern dance with Twila Tharp! Five years with the American Ballet Theater?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, everybody lies on their resume, okay. I wasn't one of the Zoom Kids either.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, can you dance at all?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I can dance, y'know. (starts to dance really, really, really badly)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh no, no, no, no.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (covering her mouth in shock) What, what is that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sure, it looks stupid now, there's no music playing.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right, I have to get that, but no-no. (answering phone) Hello? (listens) (happily) Hi! Yeah listen, I'm, I'm in need of a stripper and I was told that you do that. (listens) Let me ask you this, what, what do you do for the extra hundred? (listens) So would I, would I have to provide the grapes?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, how was last night with Julio, senorita?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It was soo amazing, he is so sexy, and smart, which makes him even sexier. Oh gosh, I gotta so you this. Last night, we were fooling around and he stops to write a poem.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Get out! I couldn't stop if a meteor hit me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, we have our stripper. A miss Crystal Chandelier.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well sure, you name a kid that, what do you expect them to grow up to be?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Anyway um, when he left he forgot to take the poem with him. Now, I am like totally dense about poetry, but I think it's pretty good all right. Check it out. (hands them the poem)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (reading) The Empty Vase. Translucent beauty...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: To yourself. (finishing) Hey-hey-hey, y'know what that's pretty good.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh good, I think so too. Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm so glad you guys like it. Yay! All right I gotta go to work. (tries to take the poem)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, I'm not done.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, just give it back to me when your done. See you guys.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Bye-bye.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God, oh my God! Poor Monica!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What, what, what?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?! He was with her when he wrote this poem. Look, (reading) 'My vessel so empty with nothing inside. Now that I've touched you, you seem emptier still.' He thinks Monica is empty, she is the empty vase!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You really think that is what he meant?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, totally. Oh, God, oh, she seemed so happy too.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Done.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel's office, her desk is covered with stuff Ross has sent her.]

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: (reaching through the flowers) Do you have the, the Ralph Lauren file?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, sure, it's umm... (she picks up this bug and it starts to play the theme from Love Story)

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Wh-what's that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's from Ross, it's a love bug.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Wow! Somebody wants people to know you have a boyfriend.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh no, no-no-no, that's not, not, not, what he is doing. He's just, he's just really romantic.

dialogue.speaker: MAN
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: MAN
dialogue.text: (being joined by the rest of the barbershop quartet) One, two, three...

dialogue.speaker: QUARTET
dialogue.text: (singing) Congratulations on your first week at your brand new job! It won't be long before your the boss.

dialogue.speaker: THE BASS BARBER
dialogue.text: Omm-pah, omm-pah, omm-pah.

dialogue.speaker: QUARTET
dialogue.text: (singing) And you know who will be there to support... you?! Your one and only boyfriend...

dialogue.speaker: THE BASS BARBER
dialogue.text: It's nice to have a boyfriend.

dialogue.speaker: QUARTET
dialogue.text: Your loyal loving boyfriend Ross..... Ross!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering the living room from her
bedroom.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm hurt! I'm actually hurt, that you would think that I would send you any of those things out of any thing other than love. Hurt! Hurt!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right Ross!! I get it!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I mean my God...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You're hurt!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...can't, can't a guy send a barbershop quartet to his girlfriend's office anymorrrrre!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, please, Ross it was so obvious! It was like you were marking your territory. I mean you might have well have just come in and peed all around my desk!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I would never do that!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look, I know what's going on here, okay, Mark explained it all to me. He said this is what you guys do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah well if, if, if Mark said that, than Mark's an idiot.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, Joey are there.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Mark's a genius!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why?! How?! How is he a genius?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look, don't you see what's happening here. Instead of hitting on her right away, he's becoming her confidant. Now he's gonna be the guy she goes too to complain about you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What am I going to do?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, why don't you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did that. All right look, you're going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few surprise visits.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know you guys.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us, meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she starts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'Ohh, man!' And he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be like, (sadly) 'Hhiii,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!'

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: He paints quite a picture doesn't he?

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: (walking up to Mark) Here's the Shelly Siegal stuff from December.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: (turning around) And wait, I've got something for you. (kisses her)

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Mark!!

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: It's okay, Rachel knows.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, but even soo.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: I can't help it, I'm just, I'm just crazy about you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohhh! That is soo sweet! (gets up to get herself a cup of coffee)

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Okay, okay look, I know I'm being Mr. Inappropriate today, but it's just so tough, I mean see you walking around and I just wanna touch you and hold you, come on no one's around, just, just kiss me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right that's, that's it!! Get off her!

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: What is going on?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What's going on?! (throws the love bug at him) That's what's going on!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (now standing behind Ross) Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I have been down in your store for twenty minutes trying to get a tie! What do I have to do to get some service?! (turns to Rachel) Hi Rach. (He's puts his hand on her shoulder and she knocks it away.)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Joey's dance audition, Joey is warming up.]

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long Island.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So, does that mean the audition is off?

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to take these dancers and show them the combination.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, (very quickly, Joey watches stunned) up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Have fun.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Bye. (does the jazz hands)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is tying a ribbon to a vase.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What are you wrapping?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh-ho, look what I got Julio.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's a vase.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, just like the one in the poem.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well not exactly like the one in the poem.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Remember how you said you were really dense about poetry? Oh. (hugs her)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Julio) So! I'm just an empty vase, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else. And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y'know but that does not mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no right to make that kind of judgment about me.

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You don't even know me...

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you would think this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, my friend Phoebe...

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: No, it's about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (sarcastically) Oh yeah.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Joey's audition, the director has returned and wants to see the combination.]

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: All right, let's do it!

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: No, no, no. What was that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I know, it was the best I could get out of them.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Well, people!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: People, people, people.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Let's try it again, and this time let's watch everybody watch Joey. (to Joey) Show 'em how it's done. (to the pianist) Count it off.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are there.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So ah, did you have fun at the bachelor party last night?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, yeah! Look what I got, look what I got. (holds up a pen) See, she's fully dressed, right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And then you click it and, uh-oh, she's naked. And then, and then you click it again and she's dressed. She's a business woman, she's walking down the street, she's window shopping, and (clicks pen) whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she's naked! (Rachel just stares at him.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I'm, I'm gonna spend some alone time with the pen.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sits down next to her) I'm sorry, I was an idiot.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: A big idiot.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: A big idiot. Just you have to realize is, this whole Mark thing is kinda hard for me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, why is it hard, I mean we've been together for almost a year now?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I was with Carol for like eight years and I lost her. And now if it's possible I think I love you even more. So, it's hard for me to believe that I'm not gonna, well that someone else is not going to take you away.

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Let it be me! Let it be me!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, that's very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people love each other and trust each other, like we do, there's no reason to be jealous. (she kisses him)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I gotta get going. Bye Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, okay Ross. Listen, this pen is kinda getting boring, so can you pick me up some porn?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Where ya going?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I've got to go pick up Ben, we've got a play date this afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh, with who?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, just this woman that I met last night at the party.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: There was a woman at the... (realizes) The stripper?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You have a play date with a stripper?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Man, I gotta get a kid. (looks at the pen and starts laughing)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, yeah, yeah. Umm, we started talking after she y'know, did her thing. And it turns out she's got a boy about Ben's age, so we're taking them to a gym-boree class. Why, is that okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sure, is she married?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ahh, no.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. (starts shaking the sugar down in a packet really hard.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Are you jealous?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noo, I y'know I don't see why she has to play with you, that's all. I mean doesn't she have any y'know other stripper moms friends of her own?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You are totally jealous.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm not jealous. All right this is about, umm, people feeling certain things y'know about strippers. And y'know, and um, I...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Honey, I love you too.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ugh. Wait, wait, wait.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Huh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Well, there's a kiss that he won't forget for a couple of hours, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. Either that, or you just turned him on and sent him off to a stripper.

dialogue.speaker: MAN
dialogue.text: (entering) Is there a Julio here?

dialogue.speaker: JULIO
dialogue.text: (to him) I am Julio.

dialogue.speaker: MAN
dialogue.text: (singing) Mister Pretensous, (Monica stands up in the background) you think there's no one finer, well but your poems are unpublished, and you work in a diner.

dialogue.speaker: QUARTET
dialogue.text: Your no God's gift to women, that's all in your headdddd. You are just a buttmunch.

dialogue.speaker: BASS SINGER
dialogue.text: No one likes a buttmunch.

dialogue.speaker: QUARTET
dialogue.text: And your also bad in bedd-edd-edd!.
